skill.name: review-code
skill.description: Provides a structured workflow for planning and executing code reviews like a senior engineer. Use when asked to review code, PRs, or plan a code review task.
skill.summary: Structured code review workflow based on senior engineer practices. Covers quality, security, performance, and maintainability checks.
skill.author: 0xmsc

security_audit.summary: All static findings are false positives. The skill is a pure documentation/workflow skill providing a code review checklist. External command references are documentation examples of CLI tools to run. Network references are metadata URLs. Cryptographic references are checklist items for reviewers to check, not actual code using crypto.

content.user_title: Review code with senior engineer checklist
content.value_statement: Code reviews lack structure and consistency. This skill provides a comprehensive senior engineer workflow covering quality, security, performance, and maintainability checks with actionable feedback guidelines.
actual_capabilities: Execute structured code reviews following senior engineer practices
Apply comprehensive checklist covering quality, security, performance, and maintainability
Run project-specific linting and testing commands
Provide constructive feedback with rationale and improvement suggestions
Track review findings and verify implemented fixes
limitations: Does not execute code - only reviews provided code or diffs
Does not integrate with CI/CD systems or Git platforms
Does not auto-detect project-specific tooling - requires user guidance
Does not generate automated fix patches

use_cases.title: Review pull requests
use_cases.description: Use the full checklist to review PRs systematically. Cover design, security, performance, and testing aspects before approving or requesting changes.

use_cases.title: Audit legacy codebases
use_cases.description: Apply the maintainability and security sections to identify technical debt, security risks, and refactoring opportunities in existing code.

use_cases.title: Onboard to new codebases
use_cases.description: Use the review workflow to understand new codebases by systematically examining structure, patterns, and quality indicators.

prompt_templates.title: Quick PR review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this pull request using the review-code skill. Focus on the main changes in {files}. Provide a summary of findings with severity levels.
prompt_templates.scenario: Quick review of specific files in a PR

prompt_templates.title: Security-focused review
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a security-focused code review using the review-code skill. Check input validation, authentication, authorization, cryptographic practices, and secrets management.

prompt_templates.title: Performance review
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this code for performance issues using the review-code skill. Look at time complexity, database queries, caching, and network calls.

prompt_templates.title: Full codebase audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Conduct a comprehensive code review of the entire codebase using the review-code skill. Cover all sections: general, quality, design, security, performance, error handling, maintainability, and testing.
prompt_templates.scenario: Complete audit of a codebase or module

output_examples.input: Review the changes in this PR that add user authentication: src/auth/login.js and src/auth/middleware.js
output: - Passwords logged in plain text in login.js:42
- Missing rate limiting on authentication endpoints
- data_processor.py:15 - Loop queries database inside iteration
- Fix: Use batch loading or preload associations
- data_processor.py:45 - Nested loop over all items
- Fix: Consider hash-based lookup for O(n) complexity
- Repeated expensive computations could benefit from caching

best_practices: Apply the full checklist systematically - do not skip sections based on assumptions
Run actual linting and testing tools when available - do not rely solely on manual review
Provide specific, actionable feedback with code examples and rationale
anti_patterns: Do not skip security sections for small or simple changes
Do not provide only negative feedback - acknowledge good practices too
Do not approve code without running available tests and linters

faq.question: What is the review-code skill?
faq.answer: The review-code skill provides a structured workflow for code reviews. It uses a comprehensive checklist covering quality, security, performance, maintainability, and testing aspects.

faq.question: Does this skill automatically review GitHub PRs?
faq.answer: No, this skill does not integrate with Git platforms. You provide the code or diffs to review, and the skill applies the review checklist manually.

faq.question: Can I customize the checklist?
faq.answer: The skill uses a standard checklist. You can guide the review toward specific areas like security or performance based on your needs.

faq.question: What tools does this skill run?
faq.answer: The skill can suggest running project-specific tools like linters, test suites, and security scanners. You must run these tools in your environment.

faq.question: Is this skill suitable for security reviews?
faq.answer: Yes, the security section covers input validation, authentication, authorization, cryptographic practices, and secrets management. Use the security-focused prompt for dedicated security reviews.

faq.question: What languages does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill is language-agnostic. It applies general software engineering principles that work for any programming language.
